Reviews.Title: Very Good For The Price
Reviews.Author: A. H. Reeves
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed with the picture quality and the ease of use.  I can expand a picture to wallpaper size on my monitor and not get pixilation.  It has several settings but can be used easily right out of the box.  The online manual (downloadable in PDF)is easy to understand & comprehensive.  The attached instructions are pretty basic.  I don't like that it has a proprietary USB cable, though spares can be had off Ebay for less than $5.  Also a person can remove the SD card & upload from it directly. It will take up to a 32 GB card according to the manual. I can get around a 100+ photos on a 1 GB card. Battery life is OK, takes 2 AA batteries.I'm not a real camera buff, I just wanted a point & shoot camera. This fits the bill perfectly for me.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Pam Martin
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these camera(s) for my (9) and (10) year old for Christmas and they love them.  I can't believe the beautiful pictures this inexpensive camera takes indoors and out.  The video quality isn't horrible, but I have seen much better...plus there is no sound when you play back your video on the camera.  However, sound is captured so when you transfer your pictures and videos to the computer, there is sound during play back.  The 3.0" LCD screen is georgous, and allows you to see the true image quality immediately.  Plus the camera runs off of AA batteries which is completely convenient....purchase with confidence.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: A. Trujillo
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera! Very nice red glossy finish, superb picture quality, Smartphoto technology: features that finds your face and adapts to the lighting of the scenery and much more! Very easy to use, very portable (smaller than a large hand) and what else must I say? Oh yeah! The price is a must buy! Best camera I have had and I HIGHLY recommend it

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: Cherie N. Williams
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera for the price.  It's lightweight and compact.  Picture quality is good and it has good features.  The only thing that I dislike is that you have to replace the batteries quite frequently.  I bought rechargeable batteries, but was disappointed that there is not a charger that fits this camera.  Also, if you put it into video mode and play it back there is no sound on the camera.  You have to download it to a computer before the audio can be heard.  This is my first digital camera so now I will know in the future what features best suit my lifestyle.  All in all, a good first time camera.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera - excellent pictures!  Very easy to use, too!
Reviews.Author: PaulD
Reviews.Content: I am an advanced amateur user of expensive film cameras for many decades and purchased this as a gift.  I am blown away by the quality of these digital images. This is a really nice camera and easy to use - small and compact, too.  Although the camera has various settings, the automatic feature on this camera will try to automatically select the setting appropriate for the scene (i.e. backlit subjects that you don't want to come out dark, come out perfectly exposed).  I can honestly find nothing wrong for a camera in this price range.  And, don't let he price fool you - you get a very good camera with additional settings (should you need them) for a GREAT price and can you believe it even comes with a tripod socket! Kodak has done a nice job with this camera...kudos to them!  And, Amazon has great prices - keep up the good work Amazon and I will return.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Roseanne G.
Reviews.Content: I was searching for the perfect replacement camera b/c I had accidently dropped mine.  I knew I wanted to go with a Kodak camera but there are so many versions.  What did I do?  I ordered a few that received good reviews and tried them out for myself. Needless to say, this one was a keeper!  The pictures are clear and the lighting gets it right everytime! Those were the two things I was looking for, clarity and proper exposure. And with this camera you get both! The amazing thing also was the price! Turns out, this camera was the least expensive out of all the others that I have tried and returned. Go figure!!!

Reviews.Title: Like they say easy,means easy to take pictures
Reviews.Author: Marshall Gaxt "Marshall G  Axt"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera and it was very easy to download pictures to your computer. Of course Amazon price is excellent at $95.00. Most places are $119.00. One thing I have to say ,always carry a extra pack of AA batteries if your going to take alot of pictures.Glad to see Kodak have a product thats as good as Nikon and Cannon.Regards Marshall

Reviews.Title: Great, inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: G. Forster
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use for my work in the home improvement business.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money and wanted good photo quality and a large video screen.  I needed an SD card to work with my laptop, and AA batteries so that I could use my NiMH rechargeables.  I also wanted a thicker body, to make the camera easier to handle while on the job.This camera had all of the features that I wanted, plus it has a great price at Amazon.  I believe that the 3" screen is an exclusive feature in this price range.I saw several reviews mention short battery life.  This didn't matter much to me, as I always carry spares.  But in the 3 weeks that I've had this camera, I've used it every day, taking over 300 photos without having to recharge or change the batteries yet.  So far, I can't find anything wrong with this one!I got a Lowepro Rezo 20 case for this camera and it's perfect for my needs.  The interior is exactly the right size for the camera, and the front pouch has room for 4 spare batteries and a spare SD card.  The belt loop is ideal for use in the field, and it comes with a shoulder strap (which I haven't used).Amazon sold me the camera, case, and 2GB SD card for less than $100, which included shipping.  You can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: C. Wells
Reviews.Content: Although this camera is not designed for children, I bought it for my 4 year old grandson for Christmas.  I was able to get in on Amazon at a price not too much more than cameras that ARE designed for children.  Those children's cameras are quite sturdy looking, but they had so few mega-pixels and the viewer so small, so I decided to give this one a try.  He took to it right away!  The little grip area helps him to hold it and he's able to reach the buttons.  He has taken some actually pretty amazing pictures with this camera.  It goes through the batteries pretty quickly, but he's taking photo after photo after photo much of the time he uses it.  Not sure how it would do under more "normal" use.  I got a wrap around always on case for it that fit nicely and helps protect the camera.

Reviews.Title: EATS batteries - many complaints about this
Reviews.Author: T. Olson
Reviews.Content: One Word - Don'tCD80, CD82 and CD182 -- all related models of the same camera, and according to multiple sources, suffers from a power/battery problem.I bought this as an entry-level camera for my daughter - only to discover it drains batteries faster than a cigarette burns.  Seriously, there were many times my daughter would only take 20 or so pictures and then the camera would refuse to turn on until we replaced the batteries.Kodak's customer repair center refuses to acknowledge the problem and insists customers purchase expensive NiMH or Lithium batteries to resolve the power problem -- even though the directions say alkaline batteries are fine!After researching this for close to a month, I've found many camera reviews AND rechargeable battery reviews that all point to this issue.  Kodak customers are reporting their cameras will only work with high-end rechargeable batteries. Some were close to throwing the camera out.  The good news is, the expensive batteries do work, but Kodak directions and packaging all indicate that alkaline batteries are fine...they even ship the cameras with alkaline batteries!This is a serious issue...most of you will purchase this camera to save money, but be prepared to spend another $15-20 for rechargeable batteries as a required add-on.Do yourself a favor and get Canon, Nikon or other higher quality brand to save yourself aggravation.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Carlisle
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kodak EasyShare C182 for my 6 year old as a reward for perfect attendance at school this year.  He loves to take pictures, and we have tried cheaper cameras that are glorified toys that take terrible pictures, don't last, or are hard to use.  The C182 gives a ton of bang for the buck and is very easy to use.  My 6-year old has figured out how to use the basic functionality, and I have started using this camera over an inexpensive Kodak that I purchased about a year ago.  Large preview screen on the back, easy modes to choose from, and video included.  It's a little bigger than some cameras, but still easily fits in a pocket.  A great choice for this price range!

Reviews.Title: Fine in "P" Mode
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: If this is your first digital camera, it would get five stars. It offers good cost-for-features value. If you are moving from a 5MP, or higher camera, it may not seem that good. The panorama stitch feature is fun to use and the shake reduction works well enough.I bought this to compare to my 5MP, Kodak Z730. The first pictures I took were in low light and were noticeably noisier than the Z730. Outdoor shots, in bright light, were not much different than the Z730.I now shoot most pictures in "P" mode. Using the menu, I set the camera for ISO 100, Sharpness to "Sharp" and Color Mode to "High Color." This gives better pictures. One reason the older camera is so good, it has the f/2.8-5.6, Schneider-Kreuznach, glass lens.The 3" LCD screen is nice, though difficult to see in bright sunlight, as most are. The buttons and menus are easy to use. If you are not used to Kodak cameras, the C182 is easy to learn. To get the most out of all of the features, download the extended user guide from kodak.comI use Sanyo Eneloop NiMH rechargeable batteries. After more than 100 pictures, the battery indicator shows about 50% left. I have "played" with the settings quite a bit and I upload pictures using the USB cable. This requires the camera to be turned on. It would save energy to remove the SDHC card (8GB Toshiba) and connect it directly to the computer. If a friend asked me about buying a C182, I would say yes.Updated August 8,2010: This is not a low light camera. No matter what settings I use, there is a lot of "noise" in pictures taken in low light. It is also difficult to get subjects in focus in low light. The exception is using the flash with subjects that are close to the camera. Switching to "Blur Reduction" mode, puts the camera back to automatic for ISO, shutter speed, etc. Using a tripod would probably resolve these issues. "P" mode is Program mode. All modes are accessed by the Mode dial on the top right of the camera. Information for modes and setting them is available in the extended user guide at [...].

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share  C182 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Atkins
Reviews.Content: This camera actually exceeded my expectations.  The anti-shake feature was a must for us.  My husband gets quite shaky when photographing people.  He hasn't had a bad picture yet with this camera.  I've already recommended it to friends and family.  Great value, great camera!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Rocks
Reviews.Author: B. Melendez "Real Text"
Reviews.Content: I've been a KODAK fan for years.  I've tried a couple other cameras, but always come back to the Kodak Easy Shares.  This one has the 12 megapixels and the pictures are GREAT!  The software allows you to crop and edit the pictures and it's just so "easy" to use.  Probably why they call it, "easy share".  I got the best price here at Amazon.com and from now on, I come here first to look for anything I want.  I didn't mention the color.  I love the color as well.  This will probably be the last camera for me.  There is nothing more I could ask for, really.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare camera AAAA+
Reviews.Author: Tim Truax
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent and portable.  Takes great pictures reliably!  Also the cameras ability to stitch side to side shots together making a very wide or panoramic picture is really something special!  I got this as a birthday gift and have enjoyed it tremendously ever since.

Reviews.Title: Amazed with this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Courtney Stacey
Reviews.Content: We bought the Kodak C182 for my daughter-in-law as a replacement for her broken Samsung.  We mainly bought the C182 because it was on sale for a ridiculously low price... but I have to tell you, I am very impressed with this camera.The Kodak is super easy to operate and takes excellent pictures in most normal situations. The video quality is better than expected as well. If it lags at all it is in low-light conditions, but even then it is much better than I would expect from a sub one hundred dollar camera.The best feature of the Kodak is the screen. It has a very large looking 3" screen that is exceptionally smooth and vibrant. It is a great screen for passing around and sharing with friends and family. Screen visibility in daylight is actually not bad.So far we have had no problems with this camera, though we really haven't had it long enough to judge durability.  Build quality seems decent; good for this price range.Conclusion:  I have a two year old Canon Powershot that I use as a backup/convenience camera to my DSLR. I love that anyone in the family can operate it and that it takes very good pictures in a wide variety of situations.  But I have to say that so far, the much cheaper C182 has performed almost as well as my Powershot, and definitely better than the Samsung it replaced. I have bought and used several cameras  in the around $100 price range (including Canon, Sanyo, Nikon, Samsung, Fuji, Olympus) and so far this is by far the best value.PROS:  Ease of use, Good Photo Quality, Nice Video, Beautiful Big Screen (really love that screen), Great value.CONS: Low-light only okay, Battery Hog

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Doc
Reviews.Content: I've had my camera for approx. 2 months and I think it's a great buy.  It's  small, colorful and the pictures look great!  So  far, my only complaints are that I can't figure out how to put the date on the picture and also, the camera depletes the batteries pretty quickly. Nonetheless, I would easily purchase this camera over and over.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Gypsylady's Emporium "Sharon J. Flynn"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this little camera.  It does everything I wanted and more.  It is so easy to use, especially for a electronically challenged person like myself.  I find the picture quality to be surperb. The software is so easy to use and the picture tranference to the computer is really easy.  The only thing wrong is that it eats batteries!  I am going to have to get the rechargeable kit for it.  Great camera for a little price.  I really do recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Easyshare not so easy on batteries!
Reviews.Author: Leonard E. Hart
Reviews.Content: I love the photos this camera takes. My ONLY disappointment is how fast it sucks the life out of my batteries. I use rechargeable batteries but I am wondering how I will recharge both sets of batteries when we go on a trip.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare.. Huge understatement.
Reviews.Author: Drifa
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best camera I have owned so far.. including other Kodak cameras. The picture quality is great, very clear, and it is extremely easy to use. Even if you are technically handycapped like me. When taking a picture, all you really have to do is point and shoot and you are almost sure to get a good picture without having to linger on the spot a long time. The only thing I do not like about this camera is the battery. It takes two AA batteries and not the small flat lithium battery. Even so.. that is such a small problem when comparing to all the other great features this camera includes.Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: Good beginners camera
Reviews.Author: Yeshodhan S. Kulkarni
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just yesterday. The picture quality and features are decent. The best thing about this camera is the big 3inch screen and 12MP pictures. Other companies with similar features price the product on a bit higher side.I did read the reviews before buying this cam about the battery issues. With the original alkaline batteries, I was able to take about 30 snaps with flash. I've brought 6 rechargeable batteries with this cam. After 8 hours of charging, the batteries were half charged and I was able to take about 45-50 snaps and the battery still isnt drained out. So I think I've got a good cam.

Reviews.Title: No Flash & Green Line
Reviews.Author: Movie Geek
Reviews.Content: We really wanted to like this camera for its great features and price but it seems Kodak must have rushed it out of the door half-baked.Out of the box the flash didn't work.  We tried every setting possible, including setting the flash to "always on"; nothing worked.  Unfortunately this ruined my daughter's birthday since this was her main gift and she wasn't able to take any pictures that evening.  We finally gave up and returned the camera to Amazon.A few days later we bought another Kodak C182 from Target (since the price was $20 cheaper) and the flash worked great.  After putting in the SD card; however, a green line appeared on the LCD screen, running vertically down the middle of the screen.  It will not go away.  Taking the card out, resetting the camera, and trying every possible setting hasn't helped.  Online searches haven't revealed any help either.Between research, returns, and running around to find a replacement we've wasted 12+ hours so we're returning this second camera and writing off Kodak for good.

Reviews.Title: Great price for a good camera.
Reviews.Author: Norm Dwyer "Norm Dwyer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son on his 6th birthday. He was always borrowing my Canon and taking amazing pictures, but I really didn't want to trust my Canon to a 5- 6 year old. So for his 6th birthday I got him this camera. He loves it, the features are wonderful and hands down trumps his toy digital camera which was only $20 less in price.

Reviews.Title: Battery life unacceptable
Reviews.Author: Love Amazon "Robin"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for Grandma who has never used a digital camera, thinking it would be easy to use.  Like most point-and-shoot Kodaks, the dial is easy and intuitive.  The pictures are good quality -- reasonably clear with good color. The flash works well if you're not too close, even in a dark room.  Pictures downloaded easily, even without installing the software.  The movie mode is low resolution, which I expected for a camera at this price, but playback has no sound when viewed on the camera. The deal-breaker for me was that the original alkaline batteries died after less than 10 photos.  I bought the accompanying charger and rechargeable batteries.  The charger only holds two batteries, and after charging for 14+ hours, I got about 20 photos.  I also tried the rechargeable batteries from my daughter's Kodak which were freshly charged in another charger, but again, I got only about 20 photos, half without flash.  The auto-focus sound it makes even when the sound is turned off and your finger isn't even on the button is annoying, but I could live with it if the battery lasted more than 15 minutes.  I stopped testing it after this -- I'm going to get something else!Pros:Easy to usePictures clear with good colorGood flashCons:Eats batteries like candy!No sound on camera movie playbackAnnoying auto-focus soundBottom line: It might work for someone who takes only a minimal number of photos, but it is frustrating for anything more than that.

Reviews.Title: excellent simple digital camera
Reviews.Author: D. Littman "history buff"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, simple, high-quality camera, able to do point-&-shoot and more sophisticated picture taking.  Actually I bought it for my 81 year old mother, who is a self-acknowledged techno-phobe.  She only agreed (volunteered, even) to get a digital camera when she realized how hard it was becoming to get old-fashioned film, and, once the pictures were taken, getting that film developed locally.My mom has taken to the camera well.  Knows how to take pictures & use the telephoto capability too.  In that sense the camera has been a great success.  Because she is a techno-phobe, with all that implies about willingness to go beyond picture-taking to selecting & deleting pictures, hooking the camera up to a computer, even change the batteries, there has needed to be support.  From younger, more technologically amenable family members.  That has worked well too.  Since we bought a card for the camera that will hold thousands of pictures.

Reviews.Title: If you like plastic....
Reviews.Author: books-a-bazillion "books-a-bazillion"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted a cheap point-and-shoot.  And that's what I got..a cheap camera.  I thought I was going to break off the top of the battery compartment just to put the batteries in.  I guess I should have added this first...it didn't work right out of the box.  Tried multiple batteries with no success.  Sent it back to Amazon the next day.  I did get excellent service from Amazon and a fast, full refund.

Reviews.Title: Our first digital camera.
Reviews.Author: Timothy
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes some very crisp, clear, and sharp pictures. We were quite surprised at how easy this camera is tofigure out. We still have not used all of the features so far. The battery life is good, using NiHm rechargeable batteries.Though we are using only a 2g memory card, instead of a 4 or an 8, we have taken - oh, at least 245 pictures and still going.This camera is very easy to get used to, even without the instructions. There are some quick step instructions, and we merelyglanced at them, and immediately began to take pictures and familiarise ourselves with it. Amazing clarity from a 3x zoom,point-and-shoot camera. The pictures look flawless, in most incidents. There were some taken in direct sun on the lens, andsome in poor light situations but those are our own fault not the camera.This one and the z915 are the best digital cameras. Amazing but true, we usually grab the Kodak EasyShare c182 for most of ourphotographs and captions. We really have no need of an expensive digital SLR camera, so these EasyShare cameras are all weneed. The reason for the z915 is merely for the 10x zoom feature.If you just want good pictures and not a huge piece of money invested, yet good, sharp, clear, and nice pictures - look intothe Kodak EasyShare c182. We have been using ours since May 5th, 2010 and have gotten some awesome pictures out of this greatlittle camera. If you want good value and great pictures for less cost - we recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quick shooter with good results
Reviews.Author: W. Rawady "citywoman"
Reviews.Content: The only thing I missed when buying this camera was that it isn't rechargable.  However, now I have invested in rechargable AA batteries for it (which almost cost more than this good value camera). It takes good pictures fast, is very light in my handbag and easy to upload.  If you want a value camera this is it.  I am not in the league of using the more expensive ones so this suits me fine and would be great for kids too, say, as a birthday gift that gets them off the couch!  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: good camerera for the amatuer
Reviews.Author: Thomas Reed
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the person who likes to point and shoot very easy to use and takes great pictures

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: B. Connell
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost a year now.  The picture quality is excellent. The camera is very easy to use but be careful, the picture setting button moves fairly easy.  Sevearl times I've moved it to the "video" setting without realizing it (ie, keeping it in my purse or pulling it out of the glove compartment) and used up all the space on my memory card.  All in all, it is a great camera for the price for the amateur

Reviews.Title: Great value and outstanding camera
Reviews.Author: Charles Christian "CharlieC"
Reviews.Content: I am amazed that this was sold for only $69 and free shipping by Amazon.  I was upset at first as it did not work and Kodak jumped right in and had me send it to them and returned quickly and in perfect condition.  My hat is off to them for the great service they provided.  The camera does more then I expected and so far the pictures have been a snap to download and work with.  My previous camera was only 3.2 MP and this is 12 and just can't say enough about it.  Good on line menu and features are appreciated.  All I had to do was buy a cheap memory card for $15 and  it will take about 1600 photos at 12 MP setting.  Should have just bought a 2 instead of a 4 card.Average person will really enjoy owning and using thie camera.I am also surprised at the length of life for the 4 Sanyo Eneloop rechargable batteries I bought on line for a low price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak
Reviews.Author: Chris A. Bell "ChuckDog"
Reviews.Content: A great little camera, at it's price point. We've had it a few months now, it's easy to use, durable, and takes quality pics. It's all I need in a camera.

Reviews.Title: A Little Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Rosalta I. Himebaugh
Reviews.Content: As far as the product goes , it is a nice camera, BUT you can not charge the batteries with the camera dock that I purchased along with this camera. And said it would. There isn't even a  battery charger for this camera. You have to constantly open the battery door to change batteries, and that is what I was  trying to get away from doing.

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, takes great pictures, is reasonably priced.  One big complaint:  it uses batteries way too quickly.  I always need to keep two spare in the camera case because they deplete even if the camera is not used much.  (Should I be taking them out of the camera when not in use?)  Anyone considering buying this camera should be aware that there is no way to charge this camera via AC or computer and you must rely on batteries.  Even rechargable ones don't last long.

Reviews.Title: kodak camera
Reviews.Author: M. Herrin
Reviews.Content: love this camera. it takes excellent pictures and the 3in lcd screen is wonderful. i previously had a kodak easyshare camera that worked great so i wanted to try another easyshare camera. this camera is good for something who wants to just click and shoot. easy to understand all the features of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Does not work!!!
Reviews.Author: Shalom Book Worm
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera at Target for a holiday gift.  When we gave it to our daughter, she put in the batteries and it did nothing.  Thinking the batteries that came with the unit were dead or defective,we used other fresh batteries that we had in the house.  Nothing.  Here's the kicker - we returned it to Target and exchanged it for another one.  Before leaving the store, we had the salesman open it up to test it.  Nothing happened!  Bad shipment?  Bad QC?  Whatever, I will not buy Kodak again.

Reviews.Title: Features Missing
Reviews.Author: Jose Perez III
Reviews.Content: This is the second Kodak Camera I own.  The first, which I'm still using, is a C340 Easy Share.  While the C182 has more features and Picture quality is great, Kodak Engineers must have been drinking heavily when they designed this one.  The left out important features.  For example the ability to automatically have a Date Stamp on Pictures.  My old camera once you set it to place a Date on each picture that's it.  You don't have to change it and every picture will have a date on it until you turn this feature off.  With the C182 you have to manually insert the date on each picture.  So if you take 500 pictures you have to do this 500 times....How stupid is this.My old C340 was able to retain the date on the camera even though it had no batteries for weeks and even months.  With this new C182 once the batteries are out for a short period of time you have to set the date and time again.  Foolish if you ask me.The pictures are great but so are other cameras.  Kodak needs to learn that when they build a new product it should have all the great features of their old products plus some new and improved onces.  If I had known that these features were left out I would not have gotten this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Digital For Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: MaryJane
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I wanted to join the digital age (cheaply!). I have alwayed owned fairly expensive Nikon products ($200 to $300) range. These cameras never lasted (family outings, being left in the car, etc.). The last one that was broken, I promised myself I would never spend that much on a camera again. I finally had to buy because I have a new grandchild. I have been VERY pleased with the quality of these images, and the ease of use. I am so glad I do not have to deal with film anymore. I am not a photo-afficienado, I just want great pictures of people and events as they happen, without alot of hassle and expense. If this is you, then this camera will work for you.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera from Amazon.com for my husband who likes to have one with him when he goes fishing.  That way he can take a photo of the "big ones."  The price helped with my decision but I also have a larger Kodak which I love as well.  It takes wonderful pictures, is easy to use and the viewing screen is nice and large.

Reviews.Title: Awesome digital
Reviews.Author: cpg
Reviews.Content: the best little camera I have seen so far, for taking quick photo's, I always hated digital pics. but this one has great outcomes.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Titanic
Reviews.Content: For the pictures:This camera takes beautiful pictures. Yes, it's not the most portable camera ever, but it has many useful settings, such as "Night," "Panorama," and "Portrait." It even has three different zoom settings! It shoots in a glorious 12 mega pixels, and the images are rarely blurry. However, the images may become less sharp if you have too many pictures on there. The camera just starts to freak out, in other words. So... Just erase the content every now and then. Other than that, it is a tremendous camera.For the videos:The videos that this camera take are pretty good, with one pretty bad downside. If you try to watch a video on this camera, it won't have any sound. Pretty wierd, right? Don't worry, once you put it on a computer, the sound plays perfectly. It's just a strange glitch.

Reviews.Title: Received cameras quickly, they work great
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M. Rynn
Reviews.Content: We received our cameras on time and in good shape.  They are for our kids, and the big preview screen works great.  Very satisfied.  Great for the price.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Lewis H. Long
Reviews.Content: The camera was a gift for my son and his wife.  They needed something that was easy to use but produced good quality pictures.  I had purchased the Kodak C182 camera for my wife at Christmas time and everyone loved it; so I decided to repeat the process.  I have not been disappointed nor have my wife and kids.  The camera takes fantastic pictures as well as video and it's very easy to use.  Even my 8 year old grandson is using it to make some funny home videos.  I did purchase a 4 Gig memory card so they would not need to keep deleting pictures in order to take many shots.  Now they can take up to 1000 high resolution pictures without deleting any.  I would recommend rechargeable batteries.  The camera arrived quickly and in perfect condition and was exactly as described.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon Rebel XS and I wanted something simple and small for when I didn't feel like lugging around my other camera. I honestly only bought this camera because it was on sale. But I am SO glad I did! It takes wonderful pictures and it is very simple to use! I also love the color the camera is (purple) as it is my favorite color. The only problem I have is that the pictures come out a little fuzzy, maybe that is something with point and shoot cameras or maybe I have been spoiled with my eos.... :) But other than that I LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: In love!!
Reviews.Author: Ace
Reviews.Content: I just ordered this camera two days ago and received it today--standard shipping (YES!!! PROMPT SERVICE, A big plus for me!!!). Packaging was GREAT!!The quality of the pictures taken are clean and crystal clear. The buttons and menu aren't as confusing as they were on my old kodak either. The camera itself is a beautiful silver.I'm extremely happy with my product and service. Would DEFINITELY recommend this seller to everyone. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures!
Reviews.Author: Patton
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It's easy to use and takes great pictures.  It does use up the AA batteries so carry some extra with you.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Joehorse
Reviews.Content: Simply put...........it's a great little Camera. Well worth the price and the Quality is there. Of course, Amazon remains the best place to shop and purchase. Try one of these cameras and you'll love it. Easy to operate, convenient size, well priced and good quality. All that combined equals a great deal.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD
Reviews.Author: Lakers "FE"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good. It is a 12.4 mp camera WITH OPTIONS for 1.2 - 12 MP quality mode. The pictures are clear and very high res as expected in a 12 mp camera. It does shoot vids but no sound in playback until you connect it the pc and transfer it. The vid is also in MOV format so thats also tricky. About the battery life, I cannot complain. It cost me 63.50 from amazon w/ free shipping. What else can I ask. The battery is probably used on the huge screen and using flash on auto mode almost every single time. Also this uses AA batteries which may or may not be liked by some people. I would have wanted a rechargeable battery pack in this, but at the end of the day i have rechargeable batteries and I can just buy batteries if there is no wall outlet plug somewhere.I would recommend this camera to other people!!! Especially the low price and reliability of a KODAK camera.

Reviews.Title: not a bad starter camera
Reviews.Author: S. A. Graham
Reviews.Content: This is a great starter camera it is not as bad as some people say i love it, you will need fresh batteries but i dont care about that it takes great pictures. Thanks kodak.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C182
Reviews.Author: Kiiirad
Reviews.Content: Camera works great, it's easy to use and takes awesome pictures! It's got all different kinds of settings for all different picture taking, very neat.This camera will NEED an SD card to take more than 4 pictures if you're going to take them all at 12MP, however.Love the way this camera looks and feels.Overall, great product.

Reviews.Title: Good battery life, good photos, decent movies
Reviews.Author: T. Isaac
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th digital camera, and despite reviews to the contrary, this one has very good battery life.  My wife's camera, a Kodak C813, is constantly depleting its batteries in only a few pictures, while this one generally lasts through an entire weekend of Boy Scout camping or vacation trip.  Perhaps other reviewers don't realize that ALL digital cameras are very demanding of their batteries.Picture quality is good, and it's not difficult to take a good shot without showing camera shake.  I've even been able to take good nighttime shots without a flash on a tripod.Movie quality is the best I've seen in a low-end point-and-shoot.  The sound does not stutter, as I've experienced with other cameras.The only thing I don't like about it is the Kodak-specific USB cable, you can't just use an ordinary mini-USB cable to connect it to your computer.  However, the package does include one of these cables, which Kodak uses with many of its cameras.This camera is a great choice for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and Great Service from Vendor
Reviews.Author: N. Turner
Reviews.Content: I recieved this product before the promised amount of shipping time and was delighted with the quality of the product, especially for the price.  This is a great point and shoot camera and the service from the vendor was excellent.

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Shutterbug "D"
Reviews.Content: We decided to replace our Kodack V530 which lasted us 4 yrs and never had to replace the battery! Well we did our research and thought that this would be the best purchase. Well I had it three days and we were on vacation in Disney with our kids of all places. First the low battery light came on after day two day and by the way we did not use but three times that day or the day before. Then on day three the flash quit working. So we thought it might be the battery causing it. After replacing the battery and reviewing the manual. Turns out the flash just quit working all together.I am returning the camera today and getting my money back! Also read ALL the features before purchase. When you record a video and play it back there is no sound. My suggestion is get a camera that has the lithium batteries. Its worth the purchase. I guess if you are just looking for a BASIC camera,this would be it minus the malfunction. But if you are looking for something a little better, spend the money!!

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Avid Shopper
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after looking at many, many reviews.  Maybe I just got a dud, but the camera has difficulty turning on.  Sometimes I can't get it to turn on at all.  I am planning to return it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare
Reviews.Author: R. Garcia
Reviews.Content: The camera is a nice size and it is the second one I have purchased.  On this camera the flash had a mind of its own as most of the time the picture was dark as the flash didn't go off.  After a few uses the flash just died completely. So all in all this camera was a dudd.

Reviews.Title: stopped working
Reviews.Author: shwamy
Reviews.Content: Just stopped working less then  2 months after purchase and of course can not return.Kodak EasyShare C182 Digital Camera (Blue)

Reviews.Title: OK Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Schweitz "Alpha computer geek"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a second camera for those times when I don't need a digital SLR.  It takes OK pictures, but I was surprised that it took batteries and did not offer rechargeable batteries.  I have a small issue with it and Lightroom as it will not import the pictures into it.The menus are also not intuitive, it takes a few minutes to figure out what you need to do with the menu to get the camera to take pictures the way you want them.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Older People
Reviews.Author: Phyllis A. Engstrom
Reviews.Content: MY mother is 81 this year and getting drug into the twentieth century Kickin and screaming. This was ALMOST painless  for her to start taking pictures. She Still liked her older 35mm camera better but this is growing on her.Thanks for your timePhyllis Engstromas per her son Dan

Reviews.Title: camera meets expectations
Reviews.Author: oasismom
Reviews.Content: this is a great camera, meeting all my expectations--good picture quality and features.  Arrived in a reasonable time from amazon and good customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: David D.
Reviews.Content: It's a camera!  That shoots pictures and videos and such, and I only paid maybe $60 or so for it.  Hooray for everyone!

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: SamSassifras
Reviews.Content: This is awesome to take on the go, I love the color! Still figuring out the technical options available, and sometimes have a hard time focusing on the subject, but overall great deal, and very good camera! Doesn't burn through batteries like my last one, so that's a plus.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture taking but bad video recording
Reviews.Author: misslovely55
Reviews.Content: Ive had this camera for about 2 and a half years now.  The piceture quality and taking is very good and an excellent buy if your going to use it only for that. But if you also want yo use it for recording videos look elsewhere. When you go back to replay your video there is no sound. And when you go and upload it to the Kodak easy share it is hard to watch and find the video you want to watch because it only shows a gray box.  I also use it to upload videos to youtube and that works horribly! When you go on youtube to upload the video it is really hard to find the video you want to upload. Because it doesn't say how long the video is or what date the video was uploaded.  That's why I'm giving this camera a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, little pricey here
Reviews.Author: son of a gun
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera refurbished on eBay for $40-50. It was my first camera, and it was very user friendly. I'll give some of the specs.PROS:lightweightneat designnice shots (I mainly use the blur reduction mode)vid quality is greatAA battery (it's great to not be stuck with no way to recharge)Cons:no camera speakers (sound only when on computerI'm pretty hard on it too, I took it to Ethiopia on a missions trip so it held up against dozons of kid handling, smudging, and dropping :). all around, great camera for $.

Reviews.Title: love!
Reviews.Author: tash.
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. its the best one i ever had. good zoom, color, speed, and flash! I use it everyday.

Reviews.Title: KODAK EASYSHARE C182 CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Carol L. Nemeth
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my purchase of this KODAK EASYSHARE C182 DIGITAL CAMERA. I have found it simple to use and perfect for my needs.

Reviews.Title: A waste of money revisited
Reviews.Author: B. Cole
Reviews.Content: I would like to edit my original, terrible review.Deciding not to toss this camera after all, I kept tinkering and eventually it did come back to life. The problem was with the batteries (I tried a different brand), or perhaps it was with the battery compartment's latch. The latch must be fiddled with--carefully--before it will firmly snap into place. The drain on the batteries is still alarmingly fast, though. I thought I wouldn't mind that too much, but it's been a big drawback.This was my original review:I was so impressed by all the positive reviews that I pretty much disregarded the bad ones. What a mistake. In total I had taken no more than a dozen pictures, if that, when the Kodak batteries that came with the camera died. I tried using alkaline batteries (which was supposed to be okay to do), but when the camera still did not turn on, I took them right out. Then, stupid me, I spent even more money buying Kodak rechargeable batteries, thinking this would solve the problem. It didn't. The camera still will not turn on. I'm beyond Amazon's 30-day return period, and I'm not sure I want to spend even more money on this dud by seeing if it can be repaired.  So I guess the camera goes in the garbage. What a waste.

Reviews.Title: Five stars and rising
Reviews.Author: Bunny
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a little over a week ago and have been thrilled with it.  I had read the reviews (the majority of which were quite good) and read a user's guide and decided to purchase it and have been super satisfied.  It's easy to use, instructions are easy to follow, and the pictures are fantastic.  I downloaded the Kodak software and there are so many options for editing photos.  I also bought a 2GB memory card (586 photos) which is plenty for me, battery charger and camera case.  This camera does everything it claims it can do with ease. Of course, I'm still learning what it can do!!  I would recommend this camera to anyone (young or old).

Reviews.Title: Good pics but not what I was expecting.
Reviews.Author: Vanessa B,
Reviews.Content: I had bought this same model in blue at a retail store and loved it. It took great pics and held a decent charge. I had lost it and decided to get the same camera through amazon. I don't know why but this camera is way different then the one I bought before. The plastic is so cheap, I thought it was joke when I opened it. The memory card won't pop out unless I use tweezers to slide it out. I'm going to keep it because I am happy with the pictures it takes for a little point and shoot. It will be more trouble to send it back.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE CAMERA WITH NO LIFE TIME
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA WAS TERRIBLE!!!! I bought it new and used brand new batteries in it, including the Kodak batteries which came with it. Within two hours of use, the first set of batteries (the Kodak ones) were completely drained and the camera would not operate at all. The next two pairs of batteries were drained within five minutes of use each. This camera was terrible and I would never suggest buying it, even though it is cheap.

Reviews.Title: Improved ease.
Reviews.Author: Sybil Barco
Reviews.Content: I'm glad that this model has the ability to set the date stamp  on all pictures, without having to do it individually.  This camera takes great pictures for the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice
Reviews.Author: Sina Rene Franques "Sina Franques"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it is easy to use, the quality of pictures is fantastic. I used one at work which is why I decided to purchase the same make and model for my home use.

Reviews.Title: KODAK EASYSHARE C182 DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: BDH
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big camera buff, but had a friend that bought one of these and it does take really good pictures being very clear.  I got a really great price at $74.99.  I looked up the current price and a new one is $139 so I got mine at almost a 50% reduction.  I wasn't looking for a real "fancy" camera and think I got a great bargain.  I could have paid hundreds of dollars for another brand, but I wanted something that was easy to use which it is.  It is described as a camera for kids, but it does everything I want it to do.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: ellie-1959
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera one month ago for my 9 year old son and he loves it.  It takes great pictures and is very easy to use. My son loves the video feature and has been making movies nonstop since he got this camera. He has figured out how to pay back the video on the camera in slo-mode or fast-mode (even reverse slo-mode/fast-mode.) I have not yet tired of hearing him chuckle and say "Hey mom, look at this one." The video quality is quite good.  He even attached the camera to the top on one of his radio controlled cars and shot some interesting action footage of our three cats, while driving the car and camera around the house!!  I read many reviews that commented on the short battery life so I invested in rechargable batteries and a charger. This has worked just fine for us. I have to say we have not had any problems whatsoever with this camera.  I have since purchased 2 more of these cameras, one for myself and one for my other son. It works better than either of my last 2 cameras, one a casio, and one a cannon sure shot. I don't hesitate to recommend this camera for any recreational camera user who wants to take great pictures and video with an easy to use camera.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Christinejoy
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome little camera if anyone is looking for an inexpensive way to take easy quality photos.I am very pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for my needs at low cost.
Reviews.Author: Phil @ Amazon
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera to keep handy to take snapshots of details around the house to show contractors. It had to be inexpensive and small enough to leave in the glove compartment, and I wouldn't fret over it if I dropped it. High end features weren't needed. This fit the bill very well.Like almost any camera, rechargeable batteries are a must-have. The AA batteries meant that the camera was a little larger, but I already had a lot of "precharged" Eneloop batteries and a good charger. This allows me to keep it in the car with a 2nd pair of spares almost indefinitely and expect to have charged batteries.Pros:Inexpensive.Takes good pictures in most cases except low-light.LCD is very nice at this price point.Flash is actually decent for this price point.Makes use of the tons of Eneloop AA batteries that I already had.Cons:The battery cover is pretty flimsy. I'd expect it to eventually break if I kept opening it, but with the eneloop batteries and a "large" SD card, that's not so often.I didn't install the software, but it locks up my computer for quite a while when connecting to one PC (actually, some other peripherals do too). I just want it to show up nice and neat like a USB drive. On another computer it's much more care-free. The problem computer is from work computer it may be due to settings there.Low-light photos are pretty bad, but that's expected at this price point. I don't really need those though for my specific purpose, so that's a very minor con.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. Bevins
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures for the type of camera it is. Takes AA batteries and life isn't that great. Would recommend to anyone looking for an inexpensive camera.

Reviews.Title: this camera works great
Reviews.Author: mariajoselucena
Reviews.Content: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002IVVDFU/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_title has an excellent image, its easy to use.it has no problem at all, i recommend it widely.great product!!!

Reviews.Title: for the money - an excellent camera
Reviews.Author: D.N.
Reviews.Content: Took the C182 camera up to Mackenaw Island for our 20th anniversary.  We got really great pictures, battery life is excellent (using the rechargable NI-Zinc batteries from Power Genix) I took over 200 pictures and many videos and the batteries are still not worn down.  Overall this camera is very much worth the 80$ I paid for it.  It would be nice if it had a better zoom, but the panorama function works very nice, got some awesome shots of the Grand Hotel.  I owned a Kodak camera when they first came out with digital cameras and it was so bad I couldn't wait for it to break.  I'm glad Kodak has gotten their act together.  Small and powerful, good strong flash, nice display, long battery life and great optics.

Reviews.Title: Kodak c182
Reviews.Author: paula orlando
Reviews.Content: So far it is a pretty good camera to take on the long dusty hikes. Finding the feature for auto stitch for 2 or 3 photos has been illusive, however, the one "stitched" photo looked great! The individual shots are not saved on the card. Only the "stitched" photo is saved. The accompanying batteries did not last very long. Replacements are still working.

Reviews.Title: Good camera eats batteries
Reviews.Author: Diane B. Clemmons "dimama"
Reviews.Content: I like the features and the picture quality, but boy does it go through batteries.

Reviews.Title: easy to use digital camera
Reviews.Author: Maggie Keyser "kteacher1"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because a friend recommended it, and I find it easy to use, a handy size, and it takes good pictures.  It does not eat through batteries very fast either.  It's a good camera for a new-to-digital person!

Reviews.Title: my son is thrilled with this!
Reviews.Author: M. Maurer
Reviews.Content: We gave this to our 10 year old son for his birthday.  It is the perfect starter camera.  It gives on screen descriptions for what each function does.  He has been trying out everything the camera does.  The only downside is that you can't hear the sound from the videos on the camera.  We haven't d/l the video yet to see if there is any sound at all.  If you are looking for an inexpensive, easy to use camera, this one is great!

Reviews.Title: Its good
Reviews.Author: C. Battle
Reviews.Content: I bought this because my family broke my other easyshare. This one has more pixels and the picture is excellent. Got it in 2 days.

Reviews.Title: Laura
Reviews.Author: Laura Rosas
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera about a month ago.  Works great and takes great pics.  We took it on vacation to Cabo with us and the pictures came out amazing!  Great deal for the price:)

Reviews.Title: Good pocket camera
Reviews.Author: L. G. W.
Reviews.Content: Nice resolution, easy to use, but in sunlight, trying to snap a moving target it's impossibly bad.  Without a rangefinder it's very hard to zero in on your object (like butterflies), but it's handy and lightweight.  I found that I only got about forty shots out of a set of Duracells so if you're going to be using it very much you'll need re-chargeables.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Rocks
Reviews.Author: C. Nueva-Espana "Beautiful Woman"
Reviews.Content: My camera arrived very quickly and looked like new.  The view screen is large and the camera is easy to hold in my hand.  It came with a case, batteries and 4GPdisc.  What a surprise to have all this included.  Thank for making this all possible. The Beautiful Woman

Reviews.Title: WOW.
Reviews.Author: starfish "star"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera the other day at walmart because the one i wanted was sold out,but don't get me wrong,i love it! The pictures are clear ,it is a good size,it has a nice color,and is is just plain old cool!(if you are looking to buy a camera,do it the kodak cd82 way. don't listen to anybody who says bad things about it.)

Reviews.Title: Best Cheep Point & Shoot Camera ever , choose this over Nikon Coolpix L20
Reviews.Author: fadela
Reviews.Content: It come's with black strap, USB Cable, installation CD, user guide manual,and 2 Kodak AA Alkaline batteries.Pros:* Best of the Best in it's price range.* easy to use.* 3.0 in LCD crystal clear finish (230K pixels).* 12.0 MP (4000 × 3000) -- 4:3.* picture color so natural.* Video VGA (640 × 480) at 30 fps (DVD quality).* 16 MB internal memory .Cons:* ISO from 80 to 1000 in all modes .* 3X Optical zoom only (camra size is big) why not 10X Optical zoom!.* no charger AA Alkaline batteries but in some how it's good!.* EASYSHARE if you want to come out of your closet (do not press it).

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jrad
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Very easy to use the only down side is it only holds 4 pictures on the camera its self so you must purchase the memory card but other than that its a easy, light weight camera. Takes great pictures. Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C182
Reviews.Author: Luisa Maldonado-Stiers
Reviews.Content: Excellent little camera. Takes great crisp pictures and the videos are equally as sharp. The LCD screen is great. Only drawback is that the camera doesn't have a viewfinder and taking pictures in bright sunlight is nearly impossible as you can't see your subjects. Its easy to use and uses double AA batteries. Battery life is excellent. I didn't have to replace batteries until after 4 months of continued use. This is a plus. I am looking to buy an LCD cover so that I will be able to use it in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: An acceptable starter camera
Reviews.Author: Amy B.
Reviews.Content: I chose this as my first digital camera because it was inexpensive but seemed to have a lot of good features. It is easy to use and seems to take great pictures, although I have nothing to compare to. But the quality of the camera itself is not great. The first one I got had something inside the LCD screen. I sent it back and got a replacement, which has the same problem. It doesn't affect the picture taking experience much, but it is irritating that a supposedly new camera has a defect. Overall, it is a good camera for the money but not if you are looking for high quality.

Reviews.Title: easy Share Camera
Reviews.Author: Harry Joseph Smith
Reviews.Content: this was a Valentine Day's present  My wife really enjoys this camera and it also takes excellent pictures  THANK YOU!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Product recommendation
Reviews.Author: Ender Rafael Guedez Alvarado
Reviews.Content: excellent product easy to handle recommend as it is very good and the person is also very responsible and kind thank you very much

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera
Reviews.Author: Donna J. Lowry
Reviews.Content: Do you have the software that I need to download the pictures to my computer?Kodak no longer provides and supports this camera! This information was not provided in the sales pitch!No where was it mentioned that I was not receiving the necessary software with the damera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak
Reviews.Author: Theresa M. Brown "BUYING DS GAMES QUEEN"
Reviews.Content: I got the kodak but no case came with it and it works great I really needed the case but I guess I will never get it.

Reviews.Title: Works great but:
Reviews.Author: Harleyschoolboy
Reviews.Content: I loved it! Until Kodak discontinued support! I was almost as disappointed as when the settlement from the Polaroid suite. Got $100 worth coupons with an short expiration date and you had to buy 10 rolls of film to get $1 off. Made as much sense as "a monkey on a rock"! I was almost as disappointed as the Kodak printer I bought because the ink was cheaper than the HP I was using. Trouble is : to print pictures you MUST HAVE Kodak Paper. I am so done with Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera, purple is my favorite color and it came with the cool purple case for only $80.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular for the price!
Reviews.Author: Kristin Stockton
Reviews.Content: I got this camera my freshman year of college. I'm now a senior, it is still going strong. It takes very clear, high quality picture and is easy to use. It is also fairly durable. This camera has been to Siberia with me and back. I am constantly getting compliments on my pictures, and many of my friends have agreed that it is better than their more pricey cameras. For the price, you really can't do much better.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Traci Bradford
Reviews.Content: Very Nice camera for the price. It takes decent pictures and is easy to use. I have since upgraded since I purchased this camera however my 15 year old daughter uses it every day

Reviews.Title: Distinct Design Flaw Spells Disaster - Go Back to the Drawing Board
Reviews.Author: W. Reed "East Bay Bill"
Reviews.Content: I have had this little Kodak ever since Kodak introduced it on the market and I think they may have jumped the gun before working out all of the little bugs the turn into big bugs.  This is the second one, really because 2 days before the extended warranty expired the door to the battery compartment popped off its hinges.  Brought it back to Best Buy that day and the Goonie Squad stood then and looked at the two pieces, looked at each other, looked down at the camera again, looked at each other and then both slowly turned their heads towards me as if it were some kind of sychronized SNL skit.  They said that they would have to send the camera to the larger Goon Headquarters where they repair cameras and it would be back in two days.  a week goes by and not a peep so I go back down to Best Buy and demand my camera, a replacement or a refund.  There happened to be one of the same camera in stock and so they traded with me and I purchased the extended warranty once again.  That was three years ago so this unit is no longer under warranty and about 6 months again the very same flaw occurred.  Now that I understand cameras and design a little better it is clear to see that the constant opening and closing of the battery compartment door to change batteries or disc is not supported by the.hinge which is where the plastic is the least wide,  The break occurs directly in line with the metal molding that is embedded in the door. Surely the designers at Kodak must have seen it if I could discern the weakness.  This leads me to believe that the executive board and marketing told production to move forward with this particular model so as to have it in place for the holiday season before all the kinks could be worked out.It makes me wonder how many other products has the developers and production team been forced to push through before the product was ready for consumers.  I see this happening more often than not and it seems to be the trend in competition.  Kind of like the Ford Pinto and Chevy Vega race to be the auto manufacturing to be first in launching their solution to the foreign imports that cost countless lives due to the faulty valve between the rear gas tank and the connection to the frame of the car..

Reviews.Title: Worth every bit of the purchase price and more.
Reviews.Author: Naybo
Reviews.Content: I love my camera.  The pics are so real to look at.  I can easily download my pics to the computer and print the on photo paper.

Reviews.Title: Has been a great camera
Reviews.Author: heather howton
Reviews.Content: The Kodak C182 has been a fantastic little camera. I have purchased several Kodak's in the past that have not lasted but this one is a surprise. I have had it for several years and it continues to work great. My tween age kids have been the primary users, creating videos for YouTube and taking fun pictures. I was sure it was going to brake soon after they started using it but it continues to work great.

Reviews.Title: I like the ease of use of my Kodak Easyshare C182 Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Richard N Shafer
Reviews.Content: I found the cameras size to be great when traveling.  It takes excellent pictures and the various functions work very well.  I am only sorry that Kodak products are not available anymore as they have always made a good product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera...
Reviews.Author: Wallerish "Tsalagi Asgaya"
Reviews.Content: ...or so says our grandson, who has used it a great deal since we gave it to him.  It's very easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Tank #1
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the purchase. It was as advertised and the cost was reasonable. Amazon prices save $$$$ and is ultra convenient.

Reviews.Title: The camera its self is perfect, size, controls, speed, reliability, the features allow you to take any kind of picture for any g
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Macejka
Reviews.Content: Use it every day to document my work.  Unfortunitly Kodak has discontinued the availability  to send multiple pictures to others. Very, Very , poor of kodak

Reviews.Title: Very hardy piece of equipment
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: This thing keeps working even if you drop it a lot. Amazing! The screen can get scratched just like anything else. Also, easy to use and you don't have to use the Kodak software to get your photos. Just use the USB and navigate to the camera through your computer. I did not like the Kodak program so I removed it from my computer.

Reviews.Title: Love my digital camera!
Reviews.Author: Marjo Whitt
Reviews.Content: So easy to use; makes excellent pictures!  Easy to delete what you don't like!I have just used a throw away camera for several years, as we didn't take many pictures after children were gone.  BUT, now I take all kinds of pictures.  Store what I want on computer, and don't have to develope and store new albums!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Pics!
Reviews.Author: R. Spencer "PC game review expert"
Reviews.Content: Takes excellent pictures, for the price, we use it for vacations & Ghost Hunting & works great for both, if you can't afford the higher priced better Digital cameras that cost well over $100 & even more, then get one of these, you can find them cheap.

Reviews.Title: muy bueno
Reviews.Author: Roberth Reyes "Rereyes"
Reviews.Content: Excelente producto y de buena calidad. el vendedor es muy responsable se los recomiendo. es confiable y atento con sus clientes.

Reviews.Title: loved it
Reviews.Author: Qunbch911
Reviews.Content: purchased for a gift, and she loved it, it takes great photos and the color is amazing, highly recommended thums up

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Alluundra
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price. Surprisingly durable. Functions amazingly well. The motion setting is great for those of us who have shaky hands. The video quality is what you pay for but is still better than most. Good camera for the price for a home user.

Reviews.Title: Purchased 3 of these...
Reviews.Author: Rick Farone
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad camera for the person who wants convenience of handling bulky items. The price was also nice!

Reviews.Title: review
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It takes great pictures as well as videos both inside and outside. I really think it is a great value!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: TAKER
Reviews.Content: I have owned one for about 5 years now. Bought this as a Christmas present for my daughter.I found this one for about half price on Amazon, and still do not understand why this silver color is cheaper by almost 40% compared to a clor like red or my blue one.Thing is, these are great easy to use cameras with all functions, zoom, video,sound, all that. However Kodak is discontinueing these, but will honor the full warranty just mail in the card. Get one while they last at a steal price.

Reviews.Title: Never worked like it should
Reviews.Author: Sharon Shopper
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my daughter and she was so excited about it, but it never worked properly.  It wouldn't take more than a few pics, then it would say the memory was full.  She called Kodak and they walked her through steps to supposedly correct the problem.  It worked for about a week and started to do the same thing.  She called back and they went over it again.  That lasted about a week.  Needless to say this was not one of my better purchases.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Kathy Leger
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself for Christmas and love it!  It takes good pictures and video.  It's very easy to use.  I highly recommend this product for anyone who loves to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: L. Pel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  I've had it for almost 3 years now and it's great! It's helped me capture memories that I wouldn't have gotten to otherwise! Works great, easy to use and affordable!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: M. Lynch
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and very easy to use.  I took it on a vacation and was amazed how good the pictures I took looked....

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Ruth Kellogg
Reviews.Content: it broke,i sent back to kodak and had it repaired and then ihe battery compent broke again so I dont use it any more.

Reviews.Title: IT IS A GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Ioannis
Reviews.Content: I like this camera because is what I used to have. I have an other 3 different kind and I like all of them.

Reviews.Title: It didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised with the good reviews for this camera. The quality is definitely not the best (images are not that clear) compare to other affordable digital cameras. And it just got broken. I was taking a picture; the battery compartment opened up, and the camera froze. Can't make it work again. No big deal, I was thinking to buy a better one. I would not buy Kodak again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: argin410
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product. My wife and I have taken over 5000 photos with ours and it is still going strong.Kodak Easyshare C182 Digital Camera (Silver)

Reviews.Title: best little camera
Reviews.Author: Marianne Allen
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I have purchased several over the last few years and use them in my business. The pictures are good, clear and it takes a new picture in about a second. I highly recommend purchasing one of these.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera to take along to places I really didn't want my expensive Canon to go. I was surprised at the quality of the pictures and ease of use but downloading to a computer is slow.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera for me
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Mary Ann Moon "moth"
Reviews.Content: This camera does what I need to do without being so very complicated that it confuses this old lady.  Bravo!

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality Just Okay...
Reviews.Author: RVACountryLover
Reviews.Content: Ive had this camera for a few years, and I do have to say its a pretty decent camera for the price. The features/settings are easy to use (if you can use the internet, you can use this camera).The image quality really varies, though. Sometimes I get amazing pictures, sometimes I get poor pictures, and most of the time I just get mediocore pictures. The 12.0 megapixel has little to do with picture quality- but more to do with picture size. The screen on the computer usually puts the pictures at 4000x3000. Thats fine, but sometimes the pictures come out a tad blurry or watery. Then again- this is a digital camera, and not a 35 mm. So I didnt expect perfectionIt does have a video camera as well- which is decent and has clarity. But the audio quality will be poor. (think bad mp3). So its a trade off.All in all this camera is good if you want to take some snap shots and get some good ones in. The majority of the pictures will be just okay to use, maybe for facebook photos to show your family and friends. It does have "scene" options and flash as well. But it will not give you a great picture every use.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare C182
Reviews.Content: Love this camera ease of use nice pictures and video if you are looking for a simple camera that takes good pictures this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline B. Cox
Reviews.Content: Nice camera.  I am always happy with Kodak.  Gave this as a birthday present, and my grandson seem to like it.  I did not get to see it but have seen similar camereras by Kodak.  Great price and Great shipping

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: So far this camera has worked well. I got it a couple of days before I expected it to arrive, which was nice. The only thing I was confused about was that I assumed it would come with a case, since that's how it was advertised, but it didn't. The camera itself, though, is very good.

Reviews.Title: ummm not so good
Reviews.Author: nick
Reviews.Content: this item is giving me some problem the video shuts of in 3 min and the video is so blurry im sorry but i dont kno if i could another one but the price is good. :(

Reviews.Title: I hate it
Reviews.Author: David Boundy
Reviews.Content: This is my second and last Kodak digital camera.Some years ago, I bought a Kodak for my wife.  It drove me absolutely wild while I was trying to download pictures from the camera to computer for the first time.  It took MANY hours to get it working.  But I finally did.So for a summer 2011 trip, I bought two more Kodaks, one for me, one for my daughter.  Since I got the EasyShare software working, and when it works it really is pretty nice, I hoped to use the Easy Share software to make it easy to manage all three of our pictues together.  It hasn't worked out that way.I have spent MANY hours so far getting the computer and these two cameras to talk to each other.  They won't.  I have fought for hours with the software, trying to submit a trouble report on Kodak's web site that insists that I enter the camera model number but has no line entry for entering that model number so won't take my report, dealing with the email/chat support folks who don't read the emails and respond to questions I didn't ask, who barely understand English...  The software is completely rinky-dink, as if it were a favor that the neighbor's teenage kid did on a Sunday afternoon, not a professional, robust, smooth, "it just works" commercial grade product.  Kodak's manual is absolutely pathetic, there are no meaningful instructions (the total extent of the instructions for transferring pictures is SIXTEEN WORDS -- no help at all if things don't work), and there are no trouble shooting instructions.  And I'm a pretty smart guy--a master's in computer engineering from one of the best engineering schools, gave invited lectures at MIT on computer science, etc -- if the software for this camera is giving me trouble, well, I don't know what Kodak expects everyone else to do.)I have just plain given up.  My Panasonic, which is a full-feature semi-professional model, FAR more complicated, is far simpler to use.  It just works -- plug it in, and everything just worked like it was supposed to.  I finally just took the memory card out of the Kodak, put it in the Panasonic, and transferred the pictures that way.I am as big a fan of "buy American" as anyone, but this is the end of the line for Kodak and me.  Expect to see two Kodak cameras up for sale on eBay.

Reviews.Title: Great for Teachers
Reviews.Author: chelle1969
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera!  I have been a GA Pre-K teacher for 8 years and I have used this camera to take photos for student portfolios for the past 7 years. I use Energizer lithium batteries and the 4-pack lasts almost an entire school year and we take over 800 photos per year!It is great for point and shoot quick images and the video is amazingly clear with audio.  I have a 256 MB SD card which holds well over 200 photos.  I usually take the SD card to the local CVS and insert it into the Kodak photo kiosk and print my photos or I can insert the card into my computer and print images.  I love being able to insert them into a Word document and re-size them to print photos for class stories, charts and bulletin boards.The images are clear enough that I can reduce the photo to that of a thumbnail size and get a great image while saving ink!  My only concern was with the plastic casing.  With a sturdier construction, this camera would be even better. I am ordering another one today because my old one seems to be dying a slow death right at the start of a new school year.  I wish the battery cover was stronger as years of repeated opening/closing has cracked it and I have to use tape to secure it.Great value for the money.  If you are reluctant to purchase this item here, then I would suggest visiting a local pawn shop and purchasing one to try out but I prefer using Amazon as they stand behind their products and have great customer service.

Reviews.Title: excellent buy
Reviews.Author: Rollegirl
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent buy did not expect the quality I got at the price I paid but I am very impressed

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Robert T. Mccormick "RMCharlie"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for just a few weeks, but it is a lot of fun and easy to use. I do miss not having a view finder, but I am getting use to using the display. This is the one draw back that I have found so far. In bright sunlight it is hard to see the display.The video is great. My old digital camera would take forever to save a video to the memory card, but not so with the Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C182 Digital Camera - It's Great!
Reviews.Author: starsheepie
Reviews.Content: I first received the Kodak EasyShare C182 Digital Camera as a present for my birthday. It got broken in an unfortunate accident, and when the time came to purchase a brand new digital camera, I chose the exact same camera! Despite being the kind of camera that has a lithium battery included, this one comes with 2 double A batteries, which is inconvenient at first, but not if you invest in some rechargeable double A batteries and a charger for cheap at a pharmacy or electronic store. It has great resolution, it's incredibly "easy" to use as its title suggests, it's inexpensive, and the photos it takes are really high quality! The camera itself has a lot of features, such as letting you crop, or rotate your pics and it takes great videos too! It doesn't have a built in speaker, though, but it's sound quality is great too. And another thing I love about this camera is that there is no software you have to "pre-install" on your computer in order to use it. You just plug it in, import the photos onto your hard drive, and you're set! It's an amazing camera, and I wouldn't go without it!

Reviews.Title: Not the sturdiest
Reviews.Author: J. Roder "JR"
Reviews.Content: Bought this to carry for my job, and realize I got what I paid for. Feels cheap and almost toy like. I can't knock the picture quality, just not sure it will stand up to the rigors of work. Instructions that came with it not very informative. Will update after some time of using.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after two uses
Reviews.Author: Irunalone
Reviews.Content: Not sure what happened with this camera....  I went to take a picture and it appeared that the batteries died.  I put new ones in and it still wouldn't come on.  I tried several sets of batteries and nothing worked.  I had used the camera twice.  Amazon only allows a 30 day return period....thankfully, I had a day or two left and I returned it.  However, based on previous reviews I certainly didn't expect to be returning it and would have been highly PO'd had I not taken it out to use this last time and been stuck with a dead camera!

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C182 Digital Camera (Silver)
Reviews.Author: Patricia Pillar
Reviews.Content: used once in a month. took pictures inside of 1 year old grandson. disappointed with picture quality,med to low light ,pictures were blurry. out over 11 pictures only 4 came out acceptable.response time of camera was slow.will play around with settings and see what happens.

Reviews.Title: Camera needs repair after less than one year - Regret buying this one.
Reviews.Author: A. Savo
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kodak camera in blue at the end of last year. It was heavily discounted, so at least it was only $59.00. I wish I had saved the money and purchased a better quality camera. I was disappointed that the camera did not have the orientation feature, so I had to manually rotate the photos after I uploaded them. This was only an inconvenience, but now the camera doesn't work at all. Even when I put brand new batteries in it, the camera turns on for a second and shuts itself off as if the batteries were dead. Amazon will no longer take a return, so I tried contacting Kodak. I need to send the camera back to Kodak to be repaired.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C182 Digital Camera (Silver)
Reviews.Author: vee
